Can't wait for next season. Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/03/06 Average Rating: 3.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Craig Brewer'], 'Producers': ['Kevin Misher', 'Eddie Murphy'], 'Starring': ['Eddie Murphy', 'Arsenio Hall', 'Jermaine Fowler'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: So what I like most was to see all the actors from first one.
But that's kind of it. I stopped watching it after about 20 to 25 minutes. But then I continued but was fast forwarding in many parts.
There were for sure several funny scenes. Tracey Morgan a nice add to the cast.

For sure political overtones. Even one of his daughters (eldest daughter)had a arm band stating Democrats.
Guess we are to expect this for 2021 and beyond, being "Woke" in movies to get out the word.
However I did like that his son found true love and followed his father's path. A good positive message for any couple.

I'd give it more stars if all the gratuitous political crap was not there especially having barbershop scene which is polar opposite. Maybe the point.

Guess I'm just not woke yet.

I wish the movie success but disappointed from my living room viewing. Review Title: Just ok Rating: 3.0 --------------------------------------------------

I wish the movie success but disappointed from my living room viewing. Review Title: Just ok Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual demonstrates strong preferences for high-quality entertainment, consistently rating content between 4.1 to 5.0, indicating a favorable sentiment towards engaging characters and compelling storylines. Themes of violence, substance use, and sexual content are prevalent in their selections, suggesting an inclination towards mature, adult-themed narratives.

They exhibit a distinct appreciation for original series, particularly from Amazon Studios and CBS, echoing a desire for compelling storytelling and character development. Although the majority of reviews lean positively, some experiences reveal sensitivity to perceived flaws, leading to lower ratings when expectations are not met.

Quality standards are high, with a tendency to gravitate towards well-known actors and established directors, indicating a preference for perceived reliability in production value. Price sensitivity appears low, as the willingness to engage with various series and films suggests the individual’s focus is on enjoyment rather than cost.

Overall, the core preferences are for engaging, character-driven stories that balance mature themes with strong production values, showcasing a commitment to quality viewing experiences. The individual often expresses anticipation for future episodes or seasons, reflecting a desire for continued engagement with beloved series.

target_interaction.title: Need something to watch , it's Okay
target_interaction.text:
I like the actor MB who's was in Creed. He did a good job in the role but overall, trying to tie Clancy characters together from one to be the other can be challenging.

Clark, Ritter, and Grier relative. Movie was much shorter than usual Clancy ones and I am sure the reason why they storyline is a little thin and characters a little lacking as not as much build up in prior movies.

Political correctness in military, get used to it because it's coming now more rapid than in past. Glad I am out as some things can be good but interjection of politics has and always will be bad.
